# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is the solution for your problem. This function uses the built-in DateFormat.jl package to extract year and month from DateTime object and then concatenates them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> DateFormat.format("yyMM", x), df[:dt])
end
```

The `map` function applies a function to all elements in the column and returns a new column with the results. The second argument of `map` is a function that takes a DateTime object and formats it as "yyMM".

If you want to use this function on a DataFrame df, just call:
```julia
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This will add a new column `ym` with the year-month value for each row in your DataFrame.
